akn:section.akn:heading: Liquidation and rehabilitation of protected cells.

akn:content.akn:p: If a protected cell captive insurer with one or more protected cells is being liquidated under this chapter, the protected cell captive insurer shall not be deemed to have no assets and no liabilities if the protected cell captive insurer continues to have a protected cell.
In the course of the liquidating the protected cell captive insurer, each protected cell shall be:
If a protected cell captive insurer is being liquidated, the liquidation shall not apply with respect to any protected cell of the protected cell captive insurer.

If a protected cell of a protected cell captive insurer is being liquidated, the liquidation shall not apply with respect to the protected cell captive insurer or any other protected cell of the protected cell captive insurer.

The court, on the application of a protected cell captive insurer, may determine, in accordance with this chapter, if a liability of the protected cell captive insurer shall be satisfied by its general assets, by the cell assets of a specific protected cell of the company, or by a combination of those assets.
Notwithstanding any statutory provision or rule of law to the contrary, in the winding-up of a captive insurer, the liquidator shall:
The liquidator or rehabilitator of a protected cell:
Upon the filing of a petition for, and during the period of operation of, a liquidation or rehabilitation order:
During the period of operation of a liquidation or rehabilitation order:
